    <script type="text/javascript">
        /**
         * Flushes the cache if user navigated using browser back
         * Ensures all non head-lib scripts load properly when using browser back
         */
        window.onpageshow = function(event) {
            if (event.persisted) {
                window.location.reload();
            }
        };

        window.isSafari = /safari|crios|fxios/i.test(window.navigator.userAgent);
        window.safariDeop = parseInt('50');

        setTimeout(() => {
            window.digitalData = window.digitalData || {
                sysEnv: {
                    siteCode: 'creditone',
                    environment: 'prod',
                },
                page: {
                    path: '\/content\/cob\u002Dcorp\u002Dacquisition\/us\/en\/articles\/renting\u002Da\u002Dcar\u002Dwith\u002Da\u002Dcredit\u002Dcard',
                    pageName: 'creditone|' + 'Renting a Car with Credit Cards | Credit One Bank',
                },
                analyticsData: updateAnalyticsData() || {
                    programcode: null,
                    prequalificationReservationNo: null,
                    prequalificationApplicationId: null,
                    fullappapplicationReservationNo: null,
                    fullappapplicationID: null,
                    flowData: null,
                },
                cardFinderData: {
                    responses: null,
                },
                spaData: {
                    inSpaFlow: false,
                    currentSpaPage: '',
                    trackingId: '',
                },
            };
        }, window.isSafari ? window.safariDeop : 0);

        function updateAnalyticsData () {
            const path = document.location.pathname;
            if (
                [
                    'pre-qualification/data-entry/index', 
                    'pre-approved/data-entry/index'
                ].some(flow => path.includes(flow))
            ) {
                const analyticSessionKeys = ['ApplicationId','ReservationNumber','prequalResponse','selectedProgramCode','flowData'];
                analyticSessionKeys.forEach((key) => {
                    sessionStorage.removeItem(key);
                });
                return;
            }
            let programCode = sessionStorage.getItem('selectedProgramCode');
            if (!programCode) {
                programCode = document.querySelector('meta[property="skipPqProgramCode"]')?.content;
            }

            const reservationNumber = sessionStorage.getItem('ReservationNumber');
            const applicationId = sessionStorage.getItem('ApplicationId');
            const isPq = reservationNumber && reservationNumber.substring(0, 2) === 'PQ';
            return {
                programcode: programCode,
                prequalificationReservationNo: isPq ? reservationNumber : null,
                prequalificationApplicationId: isPq ? applicationId : null,
                fullappapplicationReservationNo: !isPq ? reservationNumber : null,
                fullappapplicationID: !isPq ? applicationId : null,
                flowData: JSON.parse(sessionStorage.getItem('flowData')),
            };
        }

        // data layer DCR for activation success
        window.addEventListener('event242', function () {
            _satellite.setVar('digitalData.activate.success', { event242: true });
            _satellite.track('digitalData.activate.success');
        });
    </script>

COC_46_103644_consolidatingcreditcards929.jpg","imageAlt":"Using Credit Cards for Car Rentals","title":"Renting a Car with Credit Cards","date":"May 29, 2020","topics":[{"key":"Credit Card","value":"/articles/topics/credit-card"}],"tags":[{"key":"Personal Finance","value":"/articles/personal-finance"}],"author":{"key":"Sean P. Egen","value":"/articles/author/sean-p-egen"},"authorOrArticleFeed":false,"hideImage":false,":itemsOrder":["articleParsys"],":items":{"articleParsys":{"columnCount":12,"gridClassNames":"aem-Grid aem-Grid--12 aem-Grid--default--12","columnClassNames":{"author_biography":"aem-GridColumn aem-GridColumn--default--12","article_richtext":"aem-GridColumn aem-GridColumn--default--12"},":itemsOrder":["article_richtext","author_biography"],":items":{"article_richtext":{"text":"<p><strong>FACT:</strong> You do <em>not </em>need a credit card to rent an automobile.</p>\r\n<p><strong>FACT:</strong> You may be able to rent a car with a debit card or cash.</p>\r\n<p><strong>FACT:</strong> If you use a debit card or cash for a car rental, you may be missing out on convenience and several&nbsp;other perks that renting with a credit card has to offer.</p>\r\n<p>While most rental car companies will let you settle your bill in cash when you return the car, some will <em>not</em> let you <a href=\"https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/can-you-rent-a-car-with-cash\">reserve a car with a cash deposit</a> at the beginning of the rental transaction. Other rental car companies may let you rent a car with a cash deposit, but you will most likely have to <a href=\"https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/can-you-rent-a-car-with-cash\">clear multiple hurdles first</a>—providing proof of insurance, showing a paycheck stub, filling out an application and possibly paying a fee, providing copies of utility bills, and more—plus, you may have to pay the entire cost of the rental up front.</p>\r\n<p>This can be far from a friendly, convenient rental experience.</p>\r\n<p>Using a debit card for a car rental is a bit more convenient but can still be a hassle. A security deposit charged to your debit card will likely be required at the time of the rental and, as of the time of this writing, only <a href=\"https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/is-it-possible-to-rent-a-car-with-a-debit-card-maybe-maybe-not\">three major car rental agencies</a> offer the same ease of renting a car with a debit card as with a credit card.</p>\r\n<p>The truth is that most rental car companies would <a href=\"https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/is-it-possible-to-rent-a-car-with-a-debit-card-maybe-maybe-not\">prefer that you use a credit card</a> to rent a car from them over a debit card or even cold, hard cash. “Why would they?” you might ask, given that credit card companies charge merchants <a href=\"https://www.valuepenguin.com/what-credit-card-processing-fees-costs\">processing fees</a>.&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>While it may cost rental car agencies a bit more for you to use a credit card, a credit card provides them with more security. With a credit card, it’s easier for the rental car company to recoup any damages or losses should something happen to their car. A credit card also demonstrates to them that you’re at least trustworthy and responsible enough for a credit card issuer to have granted you credit. A debit card, on the other hand, only demonstrates that you have a bank account, and cash only shows that you have enough money on hand to rent a car.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\r\n</p>\r\n<p>The point here is not that there are advantages for rental car agencies when you use a credit card, but that <em>you </em>could enjoy multiple advantages when you put that car rental on your credit card instead of your debit card or paying with cash.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span class=\"aprh2\">ADVANTAGES OF RENTING A CAR WITH A CREDIT CARD</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><strong>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Using a Credit Card for Car Rentals Shouldn’t Cause Your Credit Score to Take a Hit</strong><br>\r\n</p>\r\n<p>When you rent a car with a credit card, the rental car agency does not run a credit check on you. They’re getting paid by the credit card company, and it’s up to the credit card company to get reimbursed by you. On the other hand, when you rent using a debit card, many rental car companies first <a href=\"https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-cards/hazards-renting-car-no-credit-card/\">do a hard inquiry</a> to your credit reports to learn more about you and your creditworthiness. A hard inquiry can lower your credit score by a several points, typically <a href=\"https://www.credit.com/credit-reports/what-is-a-hard-inquiry/\">5-10 points</a> for each inquiry.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Using a Credit Card to Rent a Car Won’t Tie Up Your Funds</strong><br>\r\n</p>\r\n<p>If you use a debit card or cash to rent a car, those funds are immediately gone or tied up because one likely came from your bank account and the other is directly linked to it. But a credit card extends you credit that you don’t have to make a payment on until your credit card’s payment due date. If money is tight, a car rental made with cash or a debit card could eat up most of your available funds, which means they won’t be available for other expenditures on your trip if you’re traveling.&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Using a Credit Card May Provide More Rental Options</strong></p>\r\n<p>You may have a hard time finding a rental car agency that will rent to you without a credit card. What’s more, even if you do find one, without a credit card you may not be offered the same selection of car models or receive <a href=\"https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-cards/hazards-renting-car-no-credit-card/\">more advantageous rates</a> typically reserved for credit card rentals.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Using a Credit Card to Rent a Car Could Earn You Rewards</strong></p>\r\n<p>If you put a car rental on a rewards credit card, you could earn cash back, airline miles, travel points, or more, depending on your rewards card. These could help offset the cost of your rental or contribute toward earning you additional travel down the road.</p>\r\n<p>While there are some rewards debit cards out there, they’re <a href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/banking/checking/think-twice-about-debit-card-reward-programs/\">fairly rare</a> and typically don’t offer rewards as lucrative as those offered by credit cards. Cash is just cash, offering nothing more than the purchasing power it represents.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; It’s Typically Easier to Dispute Charges with a Credit Card</strong></p>\r\n<p>Let’s say you rented a compact car but were incorrectly charged for a luxury car when you received your bill from the rental car agency. While you can dispute charges made with a debit card, it’s generally <a href=\"https://creditcards.usnews.com/articles/why-credit-cards-are-best-for-car-rentals\">easier to dispute them</a> if you used a credit card, because you can withhold payment to the credit card company until the dispute is worked out.</p>\r\n<p>With a debit card, the rental car company already has your money, so you probably won’t get it back until the dispute is resolved. Same with cash; it’s already out of your hands and in the hands of the rental car company.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Many Credit Cards Offer Supplemental Rental Car Insurance Coverage</strong></p>\r\n<p>Using a credit card for an automobile rental could provide you with free insurance coverage—typically <a href=\"https://www.valuepenguin.com/credit-card-rental-car-insurance\">collision and comprehensive</a>—that could save you from having to purchase coverage from the rental agency. Most credit cards offer what’s called <a href=\"https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/a-quick-primer-on-car-rental-insurance\">secondary coverage</a>. This type of coverage means the credit card company only pays out on a claim <em>after</em> your own personal car insurance policy has paid everything they’re going to pay. Some credit cards offer <a href=\"https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-card-benefits/rental-car-insurance/\">primary coverage</a>, meaning their coverage can take the place of your own personal coverage and you don’t have to involve your insurance company if a claim is filed.</p>\r\n<p>Before you decline insurance coverage at the car rental counter, make sure you know precisely what your personal automobile policy covers and what, if anything, is covered by your credit card.<br>\r\n</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>When it comes to convenience, choices, and getting more for your money when you rent a car, a credit card is usually a better choice than either a debit card or cash. If you’re looking for a credit card great for car rentals and more, see if you <a href=\"/pre-qualification/data-entry/index?C1BSourceID=C1OX_SI_99&amp;C1BDescriptorID=ASA0600L00&amp;C1BSpecificationID=rentingcar_art\">Pre-Qualify</a> for a Credit One Bank credit card in less than a minute—without harming your credit score!</p>\r\n",":type":"cob-corp-acquisition/components/creditonebank/article-richtext"},"author_biography":{"author":{"authorName":"Sean P. Egen","authorDescription":"<p>After realizing he couldn’t pay back his outrageous film school student loans with rejection notices from Hollywood studios, Sean focused his screenwriting skills on scripting corporate videos. Videos led to marketing communications, which led to articles and, before he knew it, Sean was making a living as a writer. He continues to do so today by leveraging his expertise in credit, financial planning, wealth-building, and living your best life for Credit One Bank.</p>\n","authorImage":"/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/authors/Sean-Bio-Pic.png","authorImageAltText":null,"authorPageName":"sean-p-egen"},":type":"cob-corp-acquisition/components/creditonebank/author-bio"}},":type":"cob-corp-acquisition/components/creditonebank/cob-grid"}},":type":"cob-corp-acquisition/components/creditonebank/article"},"recommended_articles":{"link1":"/articles/credit-card-perks-sometimes-overlooked","link2":"/articles/10-awesome-things-about-credit-cards","link3":"/articles/how-do-travel-credit-cards-work","articles":[{"title":"Credit Card Perks Sometimes Overlooked","subtitle":null,"previewDescription":"There are several advantages credit cards offer over cash, including special perks that cash can’t match. But these credit card perks are sometimes overlooked—oftentimes because card members aren’t even aware that their credit cards offer them. Taking advantage of credit card perks and benefits could save you time, money, and maybe even a few hassles. The perks credit cards offer may vary by card and card issuer, but there’s typically no additional charge to take advantage of these benefits—they’re either free or included as part of your credit card’s annual fee.","pagePath":"/articles/credit-card-perks-sometimes-overlooked","imagePath":"/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/2021/02/104343 COC_37_103229_overlookedcreditcardperks.jpg","imageAlt":"Credit Card Perks","date":1577811074597,"tags":["creditonebank:FinancialEducation","credit-one-central-topics:credit-card"],"author":"/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/content-fragments/authorbio/tracy-scott/jcr:content/data/master","source":null,"thumbnailText":null,"link":null},{"title":"10 Awesome Things About Credit Cards","subtitle":null,"previewDescription":" Much of what you read these days about credit cards focuses on the negative: fees, interest rates, consumer debt, etc. But those little 3.37” x 2.125” pieces of plastic are neither inherently bad nor good.     <script>
        const providerParams = '';
        const path = window.location.pathname;
        const flow = path.split('/')[1];
        const sessionStorageFlow = sessionStorage.getItem('currentFlow');
        let cleanMarketingAttributes = false;
        
        if(sessionStorageFlow && sessionStorageFlow !== flow){
            cleanMarketingAttributes = true;
            sessionStorage.removeItem('MarketingAttributes');
        } 
        sessionStorage.setItem('currentFlow', flow);        
        try {
            if (providerParams) {
                const parseArrayToObj = (obj, accumulator = {}) => {
                    const toParse = (typeof obj === 'string' ? JSON.parse(obj) : obj) || {};
                    if (Array.isArray(toParse)) {
                        for (const entry of toParse) {
                            if ('Name' in entry && 'Value' in entry) {
                                accumulator[entry.Name] = entry.Value;
                            } else if ('Key' in entry && 'Value' in entry) {
                                accumulator[entry.Key] = entry.Value;
                            }
                        }
                    } else if (obj) {
                        accumulator = {
                            ...accumulator,
                            ...toParse,
                        }
                    }
                    return accumulator;
                }
                const nextMarketingAttributes = parseArrayToObj(providerParams, parseArrayToObj(sessionStorage.getItem('MarketingAttributes')));
                sessionStorage.setItem('MarketingAttributes', JSON.stringify(nextMarketingAttributes));
            } else if(cleanMarketingAttributes){
                sessionStorage.setItem('MarketingAttributes', JSON.stringify({}));
            }
        } catch (ignored) {}
    </script>

class="Col PT-1H  COL-6   COL-MD-12 "><a class="Article__links Article__tag" href="/articles/personal-finance">Personal Finance</a><span class="Article__tagsComma"></span><h1 class="Title Title--left  Article__title  Article__title--removeTopMargin"><span>Renting a Car with Credit Cards</span></h1></div><div class="Col Article__info  COL-6   COL-MD-12 "><p class="Article__author PR-1">Author:<!-- --> <a href="/articles/author/sean-p-egen" class="Article__links Article__authorLink">Sean P. Egen</a></p><p>May 29, 2020</p></div><div class="Col Article__topics  COL-6   COL-MD-12 "><p class="Article__topicText MR-H">Topics:</p><a class="Article__topic" href="/articles/topics/credit-card">Credit Card</a></div><div class="Col     "><hr class="Article__hr MB-1H MT-2H MY-MD-3"/><img loading="lazy" alt="Using Credit Cards for Car Rentals" src="/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/2021/02/104343 COC_46_103644_consolidatingcreditcards929.jpg" class="MY-1H"/></div></div><div class="Row    Article__cobGridContainer "><div class="Col     "><div class="COB-Grid aem-Grid aem-Grid--12 aem-Grid--default--12 gutter-padding "><div class=""><div id="article-rich-text" class="ArticleRichtext"><div class="ArticleRichtext__text"><p><strong>FACT:</strong> You do <em>not </em>need a credit card to rent an automobile.</p><p><strong>FACT:</strong> You may be able to rent a car with a debit card or cash.</p><p><strong>FACT:</strong> If you use a debit card or cash for a car rental, you may be missing out on convenience and several other perks that renting with a credit card has to offer.</p><p>While most rental car companies will let you settle your bill in cash when you return the car, some will <em>not</em> let you <a href="https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/can-you-rent-a-car-with-cash" class="undefined Speedbump">reserve a car with a cash deposit</a> at the beginning of the rental transaction. Other rental car companies may let you rent a car with a cash deposit, but you will most likely have to <a href="https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/can-you-rent-a-car-with-cash" class="undefined Speedbump">clear multiple hurdles first</a>—providing proof of insurance, showing a paycheck stub, filling out an application and possibly paying a fee, providing copies of utility bills, and more—plus, you may have to pay the entire cost of the rental up front.</p><p>This can be far from a friendly, convenient rental experience.</p><p>Using a debit card for a car rental is a bit more convenient but can still be a hassle. A security deposit charged to your debit card will likely be required at the time of the rental and, as of the time of this writing, only <a href="https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/is-it-possible-to-rent-a-car-with-a-debit-card-maybe-maybe-not" class="undefined Speedbump">three major car rental agencies</a> offer the same ease of renting a car with a debit card as with a credit card.</p><p>The truth is that most rental car companies would <a href="https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/is-it-possible-to-rent-a-car-with-a-debit-card-maybe-maybe-not" class="undefined Speedbump">prefer that you use a credit card</a> to rent a car from them over a debit card or even cold, hard cash. “Why would they?” you might ask, given that credit card companies charge merchants <a href="https://www.valuepenguin.com/what-credit-card-processing-fees-costs" class="undefined Speedbump">processing fees</a>. </p><p>While it may cost rental car agencies a bit more for you to use a credit card, a credit card provides them with more security. With a credit card, it’s easier for the rental car company to recoup any damages or losses should something happen to their car. A credit card also demonstrates to them that you’re at least trustworthy and responsible enough for a credit card issuer to have granted you credit. A debit card, on the other hand, only demonstrates that you have a bank account, and cash only shows that you have enough money on hand to rent a car.    <br/></p><p>The point here is not that there are advantages for rental car agencies when you use a credit card, but that <em>you </em>could enjoy multiple advantages when you put that car rental on your credit card instead of your debit card or paying with cash.</p><p> </p><p><strong><span class="aprh2">ADVANTAGES OF RENTING A CAR WITH A CREDIT CARD</span></strong></p><p><strong>1.      Using a Credit Card for Car Rentals Shouldn’t Cause Your Credit Score to Take a Hit</strong><br/></p><p>When you rent a car with a credit card, the rental car agency does not run a credit check on you. They’re getting paid by the credit card company, and it’s up to the credit card company to get reimbursed by you. On the other hand, when you rent using a debit card, many rental car companies first <a href="https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-cards/hazards-renting-car-no-credit-card/" class="undefined Speedbump">do a hard inquiry</a> to your credit reports to learn more about you and your creditworthiness. A hard inquiry can lower your credit score by a several points, typically <a href="https://www.credit.com/credit-reports/what-is-a-hard-inquiry/" class="undefined Speedbump">5-10 points</a> for each inquiry.</p><p> </p><p><strong>2.      Using a Credit Card to Rent a Car Won’t Tie Up Your Funds</strong><br/></p><p>If you use a debit card or cash to rent a car, those funds are immediately gone or tied up because one likely came from your bank account and the other is directly linked to it. But a credit card extends you credit that you don’t have to make a payment on until your credit card’s payment due date. If money is tight, a car rental made with cash or a debit card could eat up most of your available funds, which means they won’t be available for other expenditures on your trip if you’re traveling. </p><p> </p><p><strong>3.      Using a Credit Card May Provide More Rental Options</strong></p><p>You may have a hard time finding a rental car agency that will rent to you without a credit card. What’s more, even if you do find one, without a credit card you may not be offered the same selection of car models or receive <a href="https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-cards/hazards-renting-car-no-credit-card/" class="undefined Speedbump">more advantageous rates</a> typically reserved for credit card rentals.</p><p> </p><p><strong>4.      Using a Credit Card to Rent a Car Could Earn You Rewards</strong></p><p>If you put a car rental on a rewards credit card, you could earn cash back, airline miles, travel points, or more, depending on your rewards card. These could help offset the cost of your rental or contribute toward earning you additional travel down the road.</p><p>While there are some rewards debit cards out there, they’re <a href="https://www.bankrate.com/banking/checking/think-twice-about-debit-card-reward-programs/" class="undefined Speedbump">fairly rare</a> and typically don’t offer rewards as lucrative as those offered by credit cards. Cash is just cash, offering nothing more than the purchasing power it represents.</p><p> </p><p><strong>5.      It’s Typically Easier to Dispute Charges with a Credit Card</strong></p><p>Let’s say you rented a compact car but were incorrectly charged for a luxury car when you received your bill from the rental car agency. While you can dispute charges made with a debit card, it’s generally <a href="https://creditcards.usnews.com/articles/why-credit-cards-are-best-for-car-rentals" class="undefined Speedbump">easier to dispute them</a> if you used a credit card, because you can withhold payment to the credit card company until the dispute is worked out.</p><p>With a debit card, the rental car company already has your money, so you probably won’t get it back until the dispute is resolved. Same with cash; it’s already out of your hands and in the hands of the rental car company.  </p><p> </p><p><strong>6.      Many Credit Cards Offer Supplemental Rental Car Insurance Coverage</strong></p><p>Using a credit card for an automobile rental could provide you with free insurance coverage—typically <a href="https://www.valuepenguin.com/credit-card-rental-car-insurance" class="undefined Speedbump">collision and comprehensive</a>—that could save you from having to purchase coverage from the rental agency. Most credit cards offer what’s called <a href="https://www.autoslash.com/blog-and-tips/posts/a-quick-primer-on-car-rental-insurance" class="undefined Speedbump">secondary coverage</a>. This type of coverage means the credit card company only pays out on a claim <em>after</em> your own personal car insurance policy has paid everything they’re going to pay. Some credit cards offer <a href="https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/credit-card-benefits/rental-car-insurance/" class="undefined Speedbump">primary coverage</a>, meaning their coverage can take the place of your own personal coverage and you don’t have to involve your insurance company if a claim is filed.</p><p>Before you decline insurance coverage at the car rental counter, make sure you know precisely what your personal automobile policy covers and what, if anything, is covered by your credit card.<br/></p><p> </p><p>When it comes to convenience, choices, and getting more for your money when you rent a car, a credit card is usually a better choice than either a debit card or cash. If you’re looking for a credit card great for car rentals and more, see if you <a href="/pre-qualification/data-entry/index?C1BSourceID=C1OX_SI_99&C1BDescriptorID=ASA0600L00&C1BSpecificationID=rentingcar_art">Pre-Qualify</a> for a Credit One Bank credit card in less than a minute—without harming your credit score!</p></div></div><div></div></div><div class=""><section class="Section   AuthorBio AuthorBio--articlePage " style="background-image:" id="author-bio"><div aria-label="container " class="Container Section__container AuthorBio__Container   "><hr class="AuthorBio__hr"/><div class="Row    AuthorBio__row "><div class="AuthorBio__authorImageCol"><img class="Image AuthorBio__image" src="/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/authors/Sean-Bio-Pic.png" alt="Photo of the author" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="AuthorBio__aboutTheAuthorCol"><p class="AuthorBio__authorHeader">About the author:</p><a class="AuthorBio__authorName" href="/articles/author/sean-p-egen">Sean P. Egen</a><span class="AuthorBio__description"><p>After realizing he couldn’t pay back his outrageous film school student loans with rejection notices from Hollywood studios, Sean focused his screenwriting skills on scripting corporate videos. Videos led to marketing communications, which led to articles and, before he knew it, Sean was making a living as a writer. He continues to do so today by leveraging his expertise in credit, financial planning, wealth-building, and living your best life for Credit One Bank.</p></span></div></div></div></section><div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div></div></div><div class="  aem-GridColumn aem-GridColumn--default--12"><section class="Section   RecommendedArticles RecommendedArticles--recommended " style="background-image:" id="recommended-articles"><div aria-label="container " class="Container Section__container    "><h4 class="Title Title--left  RecommendedArticles__title"><span>Recommended Articles</span></h4><div class="Row     "><div class="Col RecommendedArticles__col  COL-12   COL-MD-6  COL-LG-4"><a href="/articles/credit-card-perks-sometimes-overlooked" target="_self" class="PhotoCard  PhotoCard--shadowless    " role="article" aria-describedby="title-010295072591269094 "><img class="PhotoCard__img" loading="lazy" src="/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/2021/02/104343 COC_37_103229_overlookedcreditcardperks.jpg?imwidth=360" alt="Credit Card Perks"/><div class="PhotoCard__content PhotoCard__content--shadowless"><h5 class="PhotoCard__content__title h5" id="title-010295072591269094">Credit Card Perks Sometimes Overlooked</h5><div class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper "><p aria-hidden="true" id="description-010295072591269094" class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper__description--untruncate MB-H">There are several advantages credit cards offer over cash, including special perks that cash can’t match. But these credit card perks are sometimes overlooked—oftentimes because card members aren’t even aware that their credit cards offer them. Taking advantage of credit card perks and benefits could save you time, money, and maybe even a few hassles. The perks credit cards offer may vary by card and card issuer, but there’s typically no additional charge to take advantage of these benefits—they’re either free or included as part of your credit card’s annual fee.</p></div></div></a></div><div class="Col RecommendedArticles__col  COL-12   COL-MD-6  COL-LG-4"><a href="/articles/10-awesome-things-about-credit-cards" target="_self" class="PhotoCard  PhotoCard--shadowless    " role="article" aria-describedby="title-014880366848970206 "><img class="PhotoCard__img" loading="lazy" src="/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/2021/03/104377_COC_2_101258_10_Awesome_Things_About_Credit.jpg?imwidth=360" alt="Woman with arms spread wide overlooking a lake and mountain range"/><div class="PhotoCard__content PhotoCard__content--shadowless"><h5 class="PhotoCard__content__title h5" id="title-014880366848970206">10 Awesome Things About Credit Cards</h5><div class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper "><p aria-hidden="true" id="description-014880366848970206" class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper__description--untruncate MB-H"> Much of what you read these days about credit cards focuses on the negative: fees, interest rates, consumer debt, etc. But those little 3.37” x 2.125” pieces of plastic are neither inherently bad nor good. They’re simply a tool that can be used, at your discretion, to purchase items with an instant, no-collateral-required loan—which, when you think about it, is really kind of awesome. </p></div></div></a></div><div class="Col RecommendedArticles__col  COL-12   COL-MD-6  COL-LG-4"><a href="/articles/how-do-travel-credit-cards-work" target="_self" class="PhotoCard  PhotoCard--shadowless    " role="article" aria-describedby="title-07867312380879816 "><img class="PhotoCard__img" loading="lazy" src="/content/dam/cob-corp-acquisition/images/articles/2021/03/104429 COC_44_103871 How Do Travel Credit Cards Work.jpg?imwidth=360" alt="How Travel Credit Cards Work"/><div class="PhotoCard__content PhotoCard__content--shadowless"><h5 class="PhotoCard__content__title h5" id="title-07867312380879816">How Do Travel Credit Cards Work?</h5><div class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper "><p aria-hidden="true" id="description-07867312380879816" class="PhotoCard__content__wrapper__description--untruncate MB-H">A travel credit card—more accurately, a travel rewards credit card—can help make getting away a little easier. Especially on your wallet, if it’s the right card for you. But what exactly is a travel awards credit card, how do you know if one is right for you, and how do you go about getting one?</p></div></div></a></div></div></div></section><div></div></div><div
